name: Brains and Software: Control, AI, and Safety Architectures

chapters.name: Software Architecture and System Integration
topics: How can software architectures be structured to keep perception, planning, and user interaction modules loosely coupled yet coordinated?
What patterns and middleware are useful for integrating third-party components, cloud services, and on-board AI models?
How can developers design software that remains maintainable and extensible over a multi-year product lifecycle?
What testing, logging, and observability tools are essential for diagnosing issues in a complex robotic guide system?

chapters.name: Navigation, Behavior Planning, and Control
topics: What layers of control are needed to translate high-level destinations into safe, user-aware motion commands?
How can behavior planners balance efficiency (short paths) with comfort (smooth motion and predictable behavior) for users?
What role can reinforcement learning and other AI methods play in refining navigation policies over time?
How should the system prioritize conflicting objectives such as user preference, traffic rules, and energy conservation?

chapters.name: Safety, Redundancy, and Fail-Safe Mechanisms
topics: What safety standards and engineering principles should guide the design of a robotic guide dog's software stack?
How can redundant sensing and computation paths reduce the risk of a single point of failure harming the user?
What safe fallback behaviors should the robot execute when perception is degraded or system health is uncertain?
How can continuous self-checks, watchdog timers, and independent safety controllers be used to enforce conservative behavior?
